text: The Yarlung Zangbo Grand Canyon () or simply the Tsangpo Canyon or Tsangpo Gorge, along the Yarlung Tsangpo River in Tibet, China, is regarded by some as the deepest canyon in the world, and is slightly longer than the Grand Canyon, making it one of the world's largest. ==References== Category:Canyons Category:Geography of the People's Republic of China
title: Yarlung Zangbo Grand Canyon
